bunpro.meaning: There is no chance of, There is no way of, Impossible
bunpro.writeup: っこないis a combination of thesuffixっこ, and the い-Adjective ない. When attached to theconjunctive formof verbs, it creates new い-Adjectives that express the impossibility of (A). (A) being whichever verb is used.Common translations of っこない include 'there is no chance of (A)', or 'doing (A) is impossible'.Caution - Although extremely rare, as っこ stems from the kanji子, this grammar point may occasionally be seen in its kanji form.

examples.japanese: 今年中に30万円貯めたいの?お前の給料じゃできっこないよ。
examples.english: You want to save up three hundred thousand yen this year? There's no chance you can with your salary.

examples.japanese: どんなに鍛えてもあの人だけには勝てっこないよ。
examples.english: No matter how much I train, there's no chance that I can beat him.

examples.japanese: あんなデカい家、どんなに貯金しても買えっこないよ。
examples.english: I will not be able to buy a house that big, no matter how much I save.

examples.japanese: 明日までに５ページのレポートとか、絶対書けっ子ないよ。
examples.english: There is no way that I can write a 5 page essay by tomorrow.

examples.japanese: こんな漢字だらけの新聞なんて読めっ子ない。
examples.english: There is no way I can read this newspaper that is filled with kanji.

examples.japanese: 練習をたくさんしなくては、楽器の演奏なんかできっこない。
examples.english: If you do not practice a lot, there is no way you will be able to do a musical performance.

examples.japanese: 日本語で書かないと日本語の書き方が分かりっこない。
examples.english: If you do not write in Japanese, there is no way you will understand how to write in it.

examples.japanese: 怒ったお母さん：「ひきこもりのように、一日中家でゲームしてばかりでは、何も成し遂げっこない。」
examples.english: Angry mother: 'There is no way you are going to accomplish anything if you are just sitting at home, playing games like a hikikomori.'

examples.japanese: A：「試験は明日だよ！」B：「明日?明日までに資料全部なんて読めっこない。」
examples.english: A: 'The exam is tomorrow!'B: 'Tomorrow? There is no chance of me reading all of the material by tomorrow.'

examples.japanese: どんなに勉強したって「は」と「が」の違いなんて分かりっこない。
examples.english: No matter how much I study, there is no way for me to understand the difference between 'は' and 'が'.
